moduleMetadataJson.name: BloodHound Ingestor
moduleMetadataJson.description: This module will execute the BloodHound C# Ingestor (aka SharpHound) to gather sessions, local admin, domain trusts and more. With this information BloodHound will easily identify highly complex attack paths that would otherwise be impossible to quickly identify within an Active Directory environment.
author: h4ng3r <h4ng3r@computerpirate.me>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: VERBOSE
options.description: Enable detailed status messages

options.name: SESSION
options.description: The session to run this module on.

options.name: SRVHOST
options.description: The local host or network interface to listen on. This must be an address on the local machine or 0.0.0.0 to listen on all addresses.

options.name: SRVPORT
options.description: The local port to listen on.

options.name: ListenerComm
options.description: The specific communication channel to use for this service

options.name: SSL
options.description: Negotiate SSL for incoming connections

options.name: SSLCert
options.description: Path to a custom SSL certificate (default is randomly generated)

options.name: SSLCompression
options.description: Enable SSL/TLS-level compression

options.name: SSLCipher
options.description: String for SSL cipher spec - "DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA" or "ADH"

options.name: TCP::max_send_size
options.description: Maximum tcp segment size.  (0 = disable)

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: URIPATH
options.description: The URI to use for this exploit (default is random)

options.name: HTTP::no_cache
options.description: Disallow the browser to cache HTTP content

options.name: HTTP::chunked
options.description: Enable chunking of HTTP responses via "Transfer-Encoding: chunked"

options.name: HTTP::header_folding
options.description: Enable folding of HTTP headers

options.name: HTTP::junk_headers
options.description: Enable insertion of random junk HTTP headers

options.name: HTTP::compression
options.description: Enable compression of HTTP responses via content encoding (Accepted: none, gzip, deflate)

options.name: HTTP::server_name
options.description: Configures the Server header of all outgoing replies

options.name: URIHOST
options.description: Host to use in URI (useful for tunnels)

options.name: URIPORT
options.description: Port to use in URI (useful for tunnels)

options.name: SendRobots
options.description: Return a robots.txt file if asked for one

options.name: Powershell::persist
options.description: Run the payload in a loop

options.name: Powershell::prepend_sleep
options.description: Prepend seconds of sleep

options.name: Powershell::prepend_protections_bypass
options.description: Prepend AMSI/SBL bypass

options.name: Powershell::strip_comments
options.description: Strip comments

options.name: Powershell::strip_whitespace
options.description: Strip whitespace

options.name: Powershell::sub_vars
options.description: Substitute variable names

options.name: Powershell::sub_funcs
options.description: Substitute function names

options.name: Powershell::exec_in_place
options.description: Produce PSH without executable wrapper

options.name: Powershell::exec_rc4
options.description: Encrypt PSH with RC4

options.name: Powershell::remove_comspec
options.description: Produce script calling powershell directly

options.name: Powershell::noninteractive
options.description: Execute powershell without interaction

options.name: Powershell::encode_final_payload
options.description: Encode final payload for -EncodedCommand

options.name: Powershell::encode_inner_payload
options.description: Encode inner payload for -EncodedCommand

options.name: Powershell::wrap_double_quotes
options.description: Wraps the -Command argument in single quotes

options.name: Powershell::no_equals
options.description: Pad base64 until no "=" remains

options.name: Powershell::method
options.description: Payload delivery method (Accepted: net, reflection, old, msil)

options.name: Powershell::Post::timeout
options.description: Powershell execution timeout, set < 0 to run async without termination

options.name: Powershell::Post::log_output
options.description: Write output to log file

options.name: Powershell::Post::dry_run
options.description: Return encoded output to caller

options.name: Powershell::Post::force_wow64
options.description: Force WOW64 execution

options.name: CollectionMethod
options.description: The collection method to use. This parameter accepts a comma separated list of values. Accepted values are Default, Group, LocalAdmin, RDP, DCOM, GPOLocalGroup, Session, ObjectProps, ComputerOnly, LoggedOn, Trusts, ACL, Container, DcOnly, All

options.name: Domain
options.description: Specifies the domain to enumerate. If not specified, will enumerate the current domain your user context specifies

options.name: SearchForest
options.description: Expands data collection to include all domains in the forest.

options.name: Stealth
options.description: Use stealth collection options, will sacrifice data quality in favor of much reduced network impact

options.name: SkipGCDeconfliction
options.description: Skips Global Catalog deconfliction during session enumeration. This option can result in more inaccuracy in data.

options.name: ExcludeDC
options.description: Exclude domain controllers from session queries. Useful for ATA environments which detect this behavior

options.name: OU
options.description: Limit enumeration to this OU. Takes a DistinguishedName.

options.name: DomainController
options.description: Specify which Domain Controller to request data from. Defaults to closest DC using Site Names

options.name: LdapPort
options.description: Override the port used to connect to LDAP

options.name: SecureLdap
options.description: Uses LDAPs instead of unencrypted LDAP on port 636

options.name: IgnoreLdapCert
options.description: Ignores the certificate for LDAP

options.name: LDAPUser
options.description: User to connect to LDAP with

options.name: LDAPPass
options.description: Password for user you are connecting to LDAP with

options.name: DisableKerbSigning
options.description: Disables Kerberos Signing on requests.

options.name: Threads
options.description: Specifies the number of threads to use during enumeration

options.name: PingTimeout
options.description: Specifies timeout for ping requests to computers in milliseconds

options.name: SkipPing
options.description: Skip all ping checks for computers. This option will most likely be slower as API calls will be made to all computers regardless of being up Use this option if ping is disabled on the network for some reason

options.name: LoopDelay
options.description: Amount of time to wait between session enumeration loops in minutes. This option should be used in conjunction with the SessionLoop enumeration method.

options.name: MaxLoopTime
options.description: Length of time to run looped session collection. Format: 0d0h0m0s or any variation of this format. Use in conjunction with -CollectionMethod SessionLoop. Default will loop for two hours
